course.subject: HLTH
course.name: Healthy Lifestyle
course.description: A compulsory, one-year course for all undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to manage their lives, learning, transitions and holistic development. Students will complete at least 45 hours of activities including physical and wellness assessments, sports skill classes, organized sports and fitness events, community service, as well as enrichment topics, for example, mental health, wellness, transitions, student life, and personal growth. Students with special personal reasons may seek exemption from the Director of Student Affairs. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.comment_content: 45 hours, 6/8 sports skill classes, a few surveys
reviews.comment_teaching:
Before taking this class, I knew nothing. I was Jon Snow.

What were these "muscles"? What was a "gym"? Fear not, this class will teach you everything you want to know on how to have a healthy lifestyle.

The seminar on how to enjoy a healthy lifestyle was very intriguing and informative. I learned many things. After the seminar, I have made drastic changes to my lifestyle.

I am now gluten free.
I am also a vegan.

There was also a seminar on why exercise is important, which came with a few demonstrations of how to perform various exercises. This was the moment that changed my life.

The feeling of exercise is better than life itself.

The pain.

Oh, the pain, from working muscles you've never discovered. It was like sex. But much, much better.

We were practicing stretches when the instructor told me to get on my hands and knees. I was excited for my very first time. I was going to receive. Receive, that is, knowledge of how to exercise.

"Today," he said. "I will be teaching you how to do push-ups." He continued to demonstrate the "push-up" a couple times.

Eventually, it came our turn to try out these "push-ups." I lowered my body slowly down onto the ground. I was tense and trying to keep my balance. My palms were sweaty. Knees weak, arms were heavy. There was vomit on my sweater already, mom's spaghetti.

I couldn't hold it any longer. I pushed myself up, and then I felt it. It was like my whole body had an orgasm, an orgasm I couldn't contain. It was pure ecstasy. It's the same confused, yet satisfying feeling when a little boy gets his first erection. It was love. It was life. It was Shrek.

Needless to say, I had to change my undies before moving onto the next exercise.
reviews.comment_grading: Very intense. High failure rate. Sometimes, the instructors can be heartless and lock you outside the room when you're late.
reviews.comment_workload: The worst part of this course is getting up for sports skill class at 9am. It is the second hardest thing in the morning. If you have the option of doing so, go for ones in the afternoon. Or just take one in the Winter Semester.

reviews.author: V.lylit
reviews.title: How healthy can it get you..?
reviews.comment_content:
Your mission is to take 45 hours out of your life to take a sports skills class (choose something that you're able to do) + any of the following:
do some sports (I actually hit the gym for an hour before class one morning!!),
take some bs/ wellbeing-related lectures (you can start taking them before the academic year starts!),
do some school-endorsed volunteering work,
take a mental health first aid class (if you have enough attendance, you get 8 hours),
or attend other activites that says they give you hours.
reviews.comment_teaching:
So you see, you've been trying to fill up the quota and maybe you're suffering along the way - but do you know that health does not only mean lack of physical illnesses? It also means feeling well - or at least you're happy about what you're doing...

Also, taking at least 1/4 of the time sitting and listening to lectures doesn't seem to be a very healthy way of filling up the hours, am I right?
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail.
Complete the 45 hour requirement, plus the surveys to pass the course. You don't need to work too hard for it, but if you're doing sports, try enjoying it? It's good for your health ;)
reviews.comment_workload: 45 hours... if you spread it out and start early (e.g. in the summer holidays - okay I know I'm a bit crazy but at least that helps reduce your load within regular semesters), it isn't a very big deal... Other than that, remember that your attendance to sports skill class is very important - and that it may end up causing you exhaustion after class.

reviews.author: ilovecatsss
reviews.title: 比想像中容易
reviews.comment_content:
講來講去都係嗰啲㗎喇，自己睇其他review啦 lol
比較麻煩既主要都係個sports skill class同埋儲鐘數呢兩part，其他既你只要跟指示做就冇問題
reviews.comment_teaching:
唯一有involve到teaching既好似淨係得sports skill class，咁就喺度講啦
我揀咗social dance，但係其實我本身想揀yoga既，因為聽講超hea，不過擺咗頭五個choice都係yoga都抽唔到就冇計啦（btw每人要填10個choice），於是就半推半就入咗social dance
我本身有舞底，而且個老師教得超慢，所以上堂都幾輕鬆（唔知點解啲男仔都仲可以跳到大汗dup細汗），不過有啲悶
btw 如非必要最好唔好頭幾堂就走堂（因為淨係可以走兩次，如果唔係就會fail），你sem尾忙到pk既時候實會後悔
reviews.comment_grading:
冇grade, 淨係得pass同fail
fyi 要check鐘數既話可以去myPortal—> healthy lifestyle course—> progress enquiry嗰度睇
reviews.comment_workload:
主要既workload除咗個sport skill class就係要儲鐘數（即係最尾activities嗰欄），assume你走兩堂sport skill class，你要喺activities呢度儲夠26個鐘先夠數
最簡單既儲鐘數方法就梗係self practice啦，唔洗真做，只要去LG4拍卡就得（住hall8/9既樓下gym room都可以拍）。食飯前去拍一拍，食完再去拍一拍，得咗。溫馨提示：每次唔可以少過40分鐘，唔係就會當你冇做過，過咗40分鐘既就自動四捨五入當一個鐘
self practice儲鐘數係爽，但係佢limit咗最多14個鐘，咁淨返嗰啲點算呢？
1. 濕9talk/ 活動
極麻煩，要逐個talk逐個活動自己reg，仲要每個活動先得嗰一兩個鐘，所以趁八月尾orientation嗰時有就好快d做咗啲先（例如嗰啲咩experience sports嗰類有兩個鐘）
engine仔福利：個engine orientation day計4個鐘
2. 義工/info day helper/ redbird
義工係點詳細唔清楚，但係我個friend靠做義工最尾嗰個月衝夠鐘數
redbird係點都係唔係好清楚，淨係知道報咗就有勁多鐘數（當然付出同回報係成正比既），基本上完全唔洗憂儲鐘數呢個問題
我自己就係靠做info day helper既，做一日就有八個鐘，輕鬆ko hlth1010😎 即使係year 1都唔洗擔心唔識做，要做既野都唔算難。咁info day helper要點報呢？首先你要去ocamp，我自己係去mech ocamp既（唔好問我點解🤦‍♀️）（利申女），到9月就會有exco yo你去做，聽講engine大o都有，其他school既就唔清楚
3. 再上多個sports skill class
算啦，一個都已經夠痛苦，就無謂再reg多個玩死自己啦

reviews.author: Sammul
reviews.title: Everyone has to spend 45 hours wondering about life in one's life, everyone.
reviews.comment_content:
One must fulfill 45 hours of pure consciousness by 5 categories below.

Orientation Module (3 hours)
Wellness Module (5 hours)
Fitness Training Module (2 hours)
Sports Skill Class Module (9-12 hours, depending on the number of classes you attend, the minimum duration is 9 hours)
Activities Module (23-26 hours, the missing hours in Sports Skill Class should be filled in with activities)
Activities are further categorized as:
Additional Sports Skill Classes
Sports Events
Wellness & Personal Enrichment Events
Voluntary Work
Practice at campus sports facilities

While I am still in the process of contemplation, I am at least enlightened with a certain grain of truth: only two elements in this course, Sports Skill Classes and all other bureaucracies which are worse than the British Civil Service Department.

Sports Skill Classes at least give you a touch of wisdom, a moment of relaxation, a net for nirvana. As I swing my 7-iron club to send a ball flying at 7-10 ms^-1 at an angle of 50°-60° every Monday, I am cleansed with this ritual. Away from all the stress and tension, I get to see the sunset in the lawn area as I warm up, and this is when I feel, for the first time, "What a wonderful world." And of course, you can always slip a record of practicing golf to make that an extra hour in self practicing.

And the rest are just tedious, boring and bureaucratic procedures that I mostly avoid by having extra Sports Classes and self practice hours. Some may need assistance in mental health and HLTH1010 may provide good alternatives for them to ask for help or relieve stress. But me? These things only worsen my mental well-being.

My honest thought is to just keep Sports Skill Classes and make all others optional.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I am satisfied with my coach in Sports Skill Classes. He knows the sports they teach well, fixes postures and angles as we swing, and speaks in different languages that suit our needs the most. Nothing more I would expect of.

And since there is no way making bureaucratic content fun, I am also satisfied with teaching in other elements in HLTH 1010.
reviews.comment_grading: This is a P/F course which you pass by fulfilling the 45 hours requirement. Seems good for me.
reviews.comment_workload: Some say 45 hours drain their souls out. For me, a proportion of these 45 hours is actually spent to make my life in UST slightly more positive, so I find this workload very acceptable.

reviews.author: kozi
reviews.comment_content: depending on what lectures and events you attend, joining zoom meetings hosted by wellness center is easy way to get hours. When applying for the sports skill classes make sure you apply to multiple as it is a random draw to see who gets into the class. You can try the deep stretch yoga zoom class, easiest class you will ever find
reviews.comment_teaching: instructors just teach whatever they want
reviews.comment_grading: as long as you complete the hours you get the credit. if you want to book courts for ust please do it earlier since it would be gone asap.
reviews.comment_workload: Have to cosntantly go to events and gym to get hours

reviews.author: AnonStudent
reviews.comment_content:
Honestly, is it weird that I like HLTH1010?

For HLTH1010 we have to do 45 hours of activity (not necessarily all physical exercise). Some of them are easily achieved by doing compulsory forms (e.g. the wellbeing form and the entry form).
Others are achieved by attending seminars for Wellbeing and Personal Growth
Some of the seminars I've attended is non-verbal communication (very interesting, Beatrice is very engaging!) and a Make Your Meetings Work seminar (with very useful tips)
It's also forced me to go on evening walks/jogs on the field (one of the easier options). I've found this easier and more fun to do with friends, and getting the hour points is like a bonus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Sports Skill class I had chosen was Introduction Jazz Dance, with Stephanie YOUNG.

Now I like to dance but I wouldn't say I'm really good but I really enjoyed the class
Our instructor gave us a lot of warmup tips, and she was really friendly (as long as you were on time).
The dances were fun too, not too easy not too difficult, and our teacher was really patient with all the students.
reviews.comment_grading: It's pass or fail. Seems fair to me - you have a whole year just to do 45 hours of exercise.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of workload, especially if you're in dorms, since you can just take a break from studying or whatever you're doing and just swipe into the field or the gym and do whatever.

reviews.author: Stress and tens
reviews.title: PE lesson in UST
reviews.comment_content:
This is a compulsory, one-year course for undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to effectively manage their life, learning and work.

In fulfillment of the course requirement, students are required to obtain a pass in each of the 5 modules and accumulating a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year.
reviews.comment_teaching: nice, kind, easy to talk with
reviews.comment_grading:
only pass or fail, pass if total hr is >=45 hrs and the combined total of min 35 hrs from the "Sports Skill Class" and the "Activities" modules

1. Orientation Module to learn the course requirements and know the University resources in helping you to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle on learning, work and leisure:
- Getting Started@HKUST & Course Introduction (3 hrs in total, via Zoom)

2. Wellness Module to enhance understanding of your wellness:
- Intake Survey (1 hr)
- Health & Fitness Assessments (2 hrs)
- Wellness Assessment (1 hr)
- Exit Survey (1 hr)

3. Fitness Training Class to learn the use of campus fitness equipment and planning for your workouts (2 hrs)

4. Sports Skill Class to learn a new sports skill (min 9 hrs, max 12 hrs)

5. Two or more of the activities in:
- Additional Sports Skill Class (max 12 hrs)
- Organized Sports (max 14 hrs, max 2 hrs per attempt and max 2 hrs per day)
- Self Sports Practice (max 14 hrs, max 1 hr per attempt and max 1 hr per day)
- Wellness & Personal Enrichment (max 14 hrs, max 2 hrs per attempt and max 4 hrs per day)
- Community or Voluntary Work (max 14 hrs, max 4 hrs per attempt and max 8 hrs per day)
to complete the "Activities" module requirement
reviews.comment_workload:
um...what do you expect for the workload of PE lessons?
fyi: https://hlth1010.hkust.edu.hk/about/year_full.html

reviews.author: nlau
reviews.comment_content:
HLTH 1010 has 45 hours of activities to do and is graded on a P/F system.
It's split into several sections, Orientation - 3 hours, Wellness - 5 hours, Fitness lecture - 2 hours, Sports skill class - Min 9 hours, Other activities - Min 23 hours. The exercise / activities are not very intensive so there's no need to worry about that.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching component would only be the skills class, for me I chose table tennis, and the teacher was quite skilled and enthusiastic, but for different skills class it may be different.
reviews.comment_grading: This course is graded on a Pass / Fail, make sure you meet the mandatory 45 hours or else you'll have to repeat this in another year.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not intense at all, as it's only 45 hours spread over your first year of studying. Just make sure to not forget about this course until the last week, or else you'll be really stressed trying to find the hours.

reviews.author: name1234
reviews.comment_content:
The course actually lasts for the whole year but this website won't let me choose.

You need to complete the following modules and get a total of 45 hours to pass this course.

Orientation (3 hours)
Mandatory online talk about orientation and the course.

Wellness (5 hours)
A series of surveys about your opinion on the course and school life. There's a health & fitness assessment but it became another online survey due to covid.

Fitness Training (2 hours)
A lecture showing you how to use gym equipment. I attended that when school was still face to face, but if it is conducted online it would probably just turn into an online talk.

Sports skill class (9 - 12 hours)
For your information, I took archery and golf. Due to covid, the classes were conducted online. You are required to show your face, but they won't check closely. Just turn on virtual background, cover your camera, and do anything you want.

The face to face sports classes are much less chill as you have to actually show up and practice the sport.

Enrolling the classes are tricky. In fall, you have to choose up to 10 classes, and they will allocate based on luck. If you're not given what you wanted, just wait until winter and spring, when enrollment is first come first served.

Activities (23 - 26 hours)
There are 5 categories in this module (Additional Sports Skill Class, Organized Sports, Self Practice, Wellness & Personal Enrichment (wellness talks), Community or Voluntary Work).

I completed the requirement for this with sports skill class and wellness talks only because I'm lazy. The wellness talks do not require camera so you're free to go AFK. I talked about the sports skill class in the previous section.

Self practice is another great way to gain hours. You can go to the gym and just sit there, and you'll get a course hour. Don't leave too early or too late though, you will get no hours if you stay in the gym for less than an hour, and you can only get one hour each day no matter how long you sit.

The actual content of the classes is meh. I'll give it a C.
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't know man, no one really listens closely, and you shouldn't either. I'll give it an A I guess.
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F course. Just complete the requirements and you'll pass. If you fail you'll have to retake it next year.

Keep an eye on your email as they'll tell you about new talks and when to attend mandatory classes.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light as you only have to get hours for participation. No assignments, no exams.

Mandatory one year course.

Orientation = 3 hours
Wellness = 5 hours
Fitness Training = 2 hours
Sport Skill Class = 9-12 hours (8 class total, can skip at most 2)
Activities = 23-26 hours

In the activities column, you can choose what type of activities to do to fulfil the requirement, which includes:

Additional Sport Skill Class (same rules applied)
Organised sports (max 14 hours)
Self Practice (max 14 hours)
Wellness and Personal Enrichment (max 14 hours)
Community or Voluntary Work (max 14 hours)

You can get a head start by checking what activities are provided before fall term (organised sports, wellness and personal enrichment).

Some activities are more easier to achieve than other (Self Practice, Wellness and Personal Enrichment).

reviews.author: SeniorBaboon
reviews.comment_content:
The Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) is a compulsory, one-year course for all undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to effectively manage their life, learning and work.

In fulfillment of the course requirements, students are required to obtain a PASS in each of the 5 modules and accumulate a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year. Students will complete at least 45 hours of activities including talks on wellness and personal management; use of campus recreational facilities; workshops on sports, mental health and aesthetics as well as taking part in volunteer work such as organizing sports activities and participating in community service.

Students with special personal reasons may seek exemption from the Dean of Students.

In taking the course, students are required to take part in:

Orientation Module to learn the HLTH1010 Course requirements and know the University resources in helping you to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle on learning, work and leisure:

- Getting Started@HKUST & Course Introduction

Wellness Module to enhance understanding of your wellness:

- Intake Survey
- Health & Fitness Assessments
- Wellness Assessment
- Exit Survey

Fitness Training Class to learn the use of campus fitness equipment and planning for your workouts

Sports Skill Class to learn a new sports skill

Two or more of the activities in sports, Wellness & Personal Enrichment and Community or Voluntary Work to complete the "Activities" module requirement

reviews.author: Vincentchan9839
reviews.title: The PE lesson of HKUST for all freshmen
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a one year course for freshmen (except you fail HLTH1010 before). You need to accumulate 45 course hours so that you can pass this course. Basically, it can be divided into 5 modules and you need to pass all of them. Otherwise, the number of course hours will be recounted in the coming academic year. Here are the modules:

1) Orientation Module : Due to COVID-19, this became a 3 hour Zoom lesson. You will know the brief introduction of HLTH1010 and what sports skill classes you can apply for. You may also ask the instructor some questions if you have anything not understand.

2) Wellness Module: Generally speaking, it is just some surveys and one fitness assessment. If you are doing the surveys fast, you can actually complete them under an hour for each of them. For the fitness assessment, it is just a series of test, like grip strength test, vertical jump test, 3-minute step test, etc.

3) Fitness Training Module: It is a 2-hour lecture and the most important thing you can learn is how to properly use the equipment inside the gym rooms.

4) Sports Sill Class Module: The most interesting part of the whole course. Usually, each sports skill class involve 8 lessons for one regular semester. Here are part of the sports skill class you can choose: karate, yoga, tennis, soccer, squash, archery, golf etc.

5) Activities Module: It includes five sub-parts: Additional Sports Skill Class, Organized Sports, Self Practice, Wellness & Personal Development, Community or Voluntary Work. I will briefly talk about Self Practice and Wellness & Personal Development here.
Self Practice is just basically you go to the gym rooms in HKUST for one hour per day. Remember to check in and check out by putting your student ID card near the card reading machine.
Wellness & Personal Development is basically talks and workshops. Usually you can enrol some of them every month, and even the orientation period before the commencement of each academic year.

Here is the link to the HLTH1010 website if you want to know more.

https://hlth1010.hkust.edu.hk/index.html

At last, here is a list for you such that you will know how many course hours are required for passing each module (including maximum and minimum course hours required) :

1) Orientation Module: Min: 3, Max: 3
2) Wellness Module: Min: 5, Max: 5
3) Fitness Training Module: Min: 2, Max: 2
4) Sports Skill Class Module: Min: 9, Max: 12
5) Activities Module: Min: 23, Max: 26

Total minimum required course hour: 45
reviews.comment_teaching:
Again, there are not much I can say. However, I think my experience would inspire some of you to choose karate class (especially for those who have a strong will to learn karate/try some new sports skills in university) and the major teaching part is from sports skill classes, so I will just mainly focus on that.

I have chosen karate class and my instructor is called Thomas Lau. He has taught in HKUST since 1991 (yes, he has taught karate here since the establishment of HKUST and I knew that since he told me and my classmates during the class). I have done some research and I even found out that Master Lau has won many karate related awards before teaching in HKUST. He has obtained black belt (1st dan) since 1980. Although he is about 60 years old, he is still energetic and professional. He really taught us the interesting concepts and skills of karate. (He is also the instructor of HKUST Karate Club. You will possibly meet him if you join HKUST Karate Club.)

I really enjoy the karate class as Master Lau is nice to all of us. He told us that the class was for beginners and just took it easy. In fact, that was true since for most of the time, you are doing warm up exercises (like stretching your arms and legs) before getting into the real part. Although the warm up exercise include jogging around the room and you may think it would be exhausting, this is not true as it is only lasts for about 5 minutes. To be true, even a few (slightly) fat classmates enrol this class and they seems not that exhausted after the warm up exercise. And of course, you will know about the importance of doing so many warm up exercise after Master Lau explain to you. He is really a whole-hearted master. :)

Furthermore, Master Lau will regularly approach you to correct your posture other than just staying in front of the whole class for the whole lesson. That is why I say he is an excellent master to teach us karate. Indeed, he would usually have a lot of interaction with us and chat with us during the breaks. This further attract me to engage in the karate classes.

In overall speaking, it is not necessary to remember all posture or skills of karate (as they are quite simple for me and you will automatically remember them if you pay attention to the class). Master Lau will help you to review what we have learnt last lesson. Furthermore, if you like to learn some karate to protect yourselves when you are in danger, Master Lau would probably be your best choice. :)

(Additional Information: Here is the link to the HKUST Karate Club and you can find more details about Master Lau by clicking the button "SENSEI":

https://karat.su.ust.hk/

)
reviews.comment_grading:
Only Pass or Fail.

There are not many things that I can say. Just remember to regularly check your progress at myPortal and please always check emails so that you will never miss anything that is related to HLTH1010. You should be fine if you can do so. Passing all 5 modules should be quite easy if you are careful and smart. :)

------------------------------------------------------------
Update on 8 April, 2022

Of course I pass HLTH1010. :)
reviews.comment_workload:
It depends.

If you are Mr Lazy/Miss Lazy, or you do not like doing exercises, you will think it is a heavy burden for you.

However, if you like doing sports, or you do workouts regularly, then you will possibly think that this is just a piece of cake to complete and pass this course.

For me, I do not find it challenging as I enjoy using the gym in HKUST and I want to go to there more frequently since they are new to me. In addition, I like playing with the training machines as I like to doing exercises in an air-conditioned environment. The sports skill class (karate) that I have applied is also very interesting since I have learnt many new and useful skills from Master Lau.

The only tip I can give is: spread the work throughout the two regular semesters. Accumulating 45 hours is actually quite easy. Especially for the Activities Module, you can easily get 23 to 26 course hours if you join some workshops and talks that will count as HLTH1010 course hours, and exercise once/twice a week at gyms.

(And most importantly, doing exercises regularly can make us stay healthy and strong. You do not want to be sick so often, right?)

reviews.author: ちきばん
reviews.title: [Relic!] Simple course but you might find it annoying
reviews.comment_content:
45 hours of compulsory activities spanned in 5 modules.
1. Orientation: Attend a 1.5-hour talk in late-Aug or early-Sept. Not useful but gives you a free 3-hour record.
2. Wellness: Surveys (at the start of fall semester and end of spring) and fitness assessments (Oct-Nov OR Mar-Apr ONLINE). Check your emails, follow the instructions, and you got yourself 5 hours in the record.
3. Fitness training: A 2-hour class on fitness and using gym equipment at the LG4 gym. Not a big deal.
4. Sports skills class: Up to 8 1.5h-long lessons of a type of sports of your choice (if you managed to enroll in one of your 10 choices) in Fall / Winter / Spring semester. See Teaching for sports. You can skip up to 2 lessons, so you get 9-12 hours of course hours.
5. Activities: 23-26 hours (If you got only 9 hours in skills class you need 26 hours here; 12 hours in skills class will lower the requirement here to 23 hours) of activities from 5 categories. See Teaching.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Missed any compulsory activities? Write an email to the Course Office. They're generous enough to arrange make-up sessions in November for the Orientation module.
Sports skills class: I enrolled into the Jazz class. Learnt dance moves for 2 songs. Adequate teaching pace and environment.
Activities: The most complex part in this course. Categories:
a. Additional sports skills class (Max 12h): You know it.
b. Organised sports (Max 14h): Sports team practice. If you find them your cup of tea, good for you.
c. Self sports practice (Max 14h): The "tapping your student ID card" activity. Easiest way to max out the required hours in this module. Whenever you're free, tap the card at any sports venue, and don't forget to wait for at least 45min to tap the card at the same place again.
d. Wellness & personal enrichment (WPE, Max 14h): Workshops. Taking part in endorsed workshops by student organisations will do. There's really A LOT OF THEM that are worth your time. Again, check your emails.
e. Community or voluntary work (Max 14h): Similar to WPE.
P.S. Hopefully you who are reading this won't have to experience a full online semester, but even in this case, when on-campus sports activities become impossible, the course office is still very nice to minimise your odds of failing this miserable course - postponement of course completion deadline, loads of additional online fitness workshops, and more :)
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F. You only need to hit the 45 hours target to pass. Will be annoying to some considering that you need to check your email frequently in order not to miss arrangements on classes and workshops.
Failed it? Retake it next year. Good luck.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light. No homework, no quiz, no exams, just activities & workshops. Don't miss emails, and you're good.
P.S. If the fitness assessments have to be carried out during the online semester, all you need to do are curl-ups, step test, and some simple measurements. No big deal.

reviews.comment_grading: Pass or Fail. There is no other grading requirements. Participate in compulsory events and activities, then you will pass. If you don't you have to retake this course next year.
reviews.comment_workload: If you are consistently allocating some of your time to sports and activities, then it is fine. However if you do not, then you will require to spend more time on it.

reviews.author: Capoo
reviews.title: Healthy Lifestyle
reviews.comment_content: This course is quite meaningful in terms of letting yourself to relax from the stressful academic curriculum of HKUST. You can be learning something different from your major and the knowledge/experiences obtained are highly applicable in your daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: For Sports skill class, I attended FE204 (Functional Fitness Exercise for Beginners at Home / Online Mode by Chris CHOW) in fall semester and WC203 (Wing Chun for Beginners (Online Teaching Mode) / Online Mode by Kenny LEUNG) in spring semester. Both instructors are kind and can deliver the course content fluently. The intensity of the course is also appropriate for beginners.
reviews.comment_grading: Passing is easy if you do sports/register talks/do community or voluntary work time to time. At least 45 HLTH1010 hours have to be attained before the deadline in Spring semester.
reviews.comment_workload:
Remember to attend all compulsory lectures like course introduction session and fitness lecture! Also complete all surveys.

The workload can be considered as 'low' for sporty people, and non-sporty people can get motivation from this course to go to gyms and learn new sport skills.

Do not miss sports skill class for more than 2 sessions (recommended to attend all!) in fall! Or else 0 hours will be counted and more have to be done in spring in order to pass this class.

Self sports practice for less than 40 minutes will NOT be recorded. Sport venues such as the artificial turf soccer pitch (ASP) requires students to tap their card once more after an hour passes. Be extra careful when tapping the card onto the card reader to prevent what happened on me🥲

reviews.author: Kj
reviews.comment_content:
Total of 45 hours.
Orientation - 3 hours
Intake survey - 1 hour
Health and fitness assessments - 2 hours
Wellness assessment - 1 hour
Exit survey - 1 hour
Fitness training class - 2 hours
Sports skill class - 9 hours minimum
Remaining hours can be made up with self practice, organized sports, wellness activities etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: All the staff are quite helpful and easy to approach.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail, with 45 total hours required to pass. The required number of hours for each module must also be reached to pass.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable if you balance everything well. Signing up for online enrichment events can help.

reviews.author: wxyz
reviews.title: Online this year
reviews.comment_content: Need to accumulate a total of 45 hours in a year (a fall and a spring semester) to pass the course. Beware of the different categories that contribute into the 45 hours: some are compulsory talks while others can only accumulate a maximum of 14 hours. Always check the HLTH1010 website to track your progress. Try to spread out the activities over the year or get more hours when you are free. Don't leave it to the last minute. Also you may also want to join the activities immediately after you receive the email as some activities are quite popular and you may not be able to join them a day later. It is also appropriate to write to the department in charge for more quota if there is really too little space.
reviews.comment_teaching: There are different types of sports activities and talks for you to choose. Some sports are rare and it gives you a chance to try them out. Some talks can be quite boring. I would suggest choosing some activities that you are interested in.
reviews.comment_grading: Only pass or fail. Passes when you fulfill all the requirements (attend all the compulsory talks and accumulate a total of 45 hours). Easy to pass. Very easy to pass if you join a sports club and go to the practice every week. Don't worry too much, 45 hours is not that much and you can accumulate it as long as you participate in some HLTH1010 activities.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to join different sports activities or talks to pass. Workload is not very heavy, but you must remember to join different HLTH1010 activities from time to time and always check your email as all communication is via email.

reviews.author: KaruizawaKei
reviews.comment_content:
To encourage students to do more exercise.
The DSTO will organize some talks. attending them can earn some hours of requirement
reviews.comment_teaching: Attending the sport class through Zoom
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F only
If we can fulfill the enquirement of 45 hours, then we can pass the course.
Otherwise, we have to enroll in HLTH 1010 next year.
reviews.comment_workload:
It will be high if you do nothing in the fall semester.
Due to the pandemic, we can have the sport class at home.

The most important point is to attend the class to earn some hours.
Also, attending some talks organize by DSTO is useful.

Some sport workshop will be organized in the spring semester.

reviews.author: clclcl
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content: It is basically about helping freshman to enhance their health. So, we learn about bunch of ways to stay healthy and need to fulfill the minimum requirement of physical activities to pass this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was good. They taught me well about how to use equipments in gym thoroughly. But students who are not interested in sports will feel this class really boring. Because it is all about sports and staying healthy.
reviews.comment_grading: Since grading is pass or fail, we just have to fulfill the minimum requirement. It might be annoying to take care of all the 5 parts of the courses, but since it's just pass of fail, its's not a big deal.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was okay. If we stick to a year plan of this course it doesn't take that much time. Obviously, better than other academic courses.

reviews.author: Cheeki_Breeki_Z
reviews.title: Mandatory 'PE lesson' like programme
reviews.comment_content:
Refer to the other comments.
45 hours of workout, seminars, zoom lessons, etc.
You also get to learn more about the sport facilities in the campus, which, tbh, is the most important thing you learn in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Varies. Depends on the courses you take. Can range from demanding, decent to boring.
Ones like yoga or archery is more 'hea' but good luck trying to register 'em.
For me, a bit bland but acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's graded pass or fail, though failing is low key hard as you just have to show up on a total of 45 hours of courses.
As long as you meet up the hour requirements, you'll get a pass. Unless you totally forget the lessons, then you'll fail, which is probably your fault lol.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is okay. Pretty flexible, lots of courses to choose from. You just play some sports and listen to a few lectures.
It's just annoying how its mandatory, and it mess up your schedule sometimes... It takes more work manage all these time slots and pay attention to promotions, than actually working out.
Overall, though, can't really complain about it.

reviews.author: chan2020
reviews.title: online lesson in this year
reviews.comment_content: 45 hrs in total. Including sports skills class, organized sports, self practice, wellness & personal enrichment, community or voluntary work.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring,  lack of choices of the sport skills class in this year. The tutor have paid effort to teach, but it is hard to make sure the students can follow each step in online teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail. You will get a pass if you attend the required hours of the  activities.
reviews.comment_workload: It provide chances to you to do sports every week. However, it is quite annoying when you are busy in that period. No assignment is required.

reviews.author: Fisch
reviews.comment_content:
45hrs requirement,The University believes that sound physical health and fitness are important components in total education and personal development of a person. All undergraduate students admitted in 2003 and thereafter must take the Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) to fulfill the Physical Education Requirements as stated in the program. Students are expected to complete the course in their first year of study.

Orientation Module

The Orientation Module is one of the core requirements of the HLTH1010 course that all new UG students will take in their first year of study.

HKUST is full of opportunities and possibilities - the secret of getting ahead is getting started!

Students are required to attend a 3-hour "Course Introduction & Getting Started@HKUST" session in late August. In the session, students will learn about the Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) requirements and the wide range of resources to support students in leading a healthy and happy life on campus. They will also learn about the part they can play so that all of us will live and learn harmoniously in a diverse and dynamic environment. In addition, they will find out what they need to know to tailor a path for their first year success through hearing stories from senior students about how they made the most of their university experience.

Upon completion of this required component, students will attain 3 course hours attendance in the Orientation module.
reviews.comment_teaching: interesting courses
reviews.comment_grading: only pass or fail( if you cant meet the 45hrs requirement)
reviews.comment_workload: 45hrs is easy, doing sports every day could easily meet the target

reviews.author: BusyBee
reviews.comment_content:
So for the introduction (the Zoom session that you attend), they make you sit there for 2-3 hours introducing all the basics and requirements of the course. It's a pass/fail course so it shouldn't be too bad.

The only thing is-- I find it quite ironic how for a "health" course which supposedly wants us to be moving and active, they arrange a three-hour session online. But I guess they have no choice bc of covid...
reviews.comment_teaching: I'm not sure if the word "teaching" is really accurate as you just kinda have to figure out your own sports/activity interests and make sure you fulfil those 45 hours... but I will say the staff are all approachable and quite helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Should be fine as long as you rmb the requirements and fulfil at least the minimum. Not hard for a pass.
reviews.comment_workload: 45 hours is not a lot, when you consider how much of it you already attain from those "required" elements... Just try to join stuff you enjoy, then you should be fine...

reviews.author: Cashmoney
reviews.comment_content: The Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) is a one-year course that teaches students how to live a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them manage their life, learning, and job more successfully. Beware that if any student fail this course, they would need to attend hlth2020 a.k.a do it again and cannot graduate in the first hon
reviews.comment_teaching: Because of the pandemic, this year is online mode. All we have to do is to open our zoom and listen to the instructor. Not everyone would pay attention to class
reviews.comment_grading: Pass/fail grading system. Students have to fulfill 45 hours of sports activity. Students can fulfill the requirement by participating in sports activities, social/voluntary work or listening to some talk/speech
reviews.comment_workload:
huge workload because you have to fulfill 45 hours of sports activity.
A lot of students in UST cannot fulfill the requirement and hence they have to attend hlth2020.

you need to go to my ust to check your progress throughout the course

reviews.author: jhdj9158

This is quite unclear to freshmen because no one tell you how to do especially 2020 freshmen. The aim for this course is to help student to relax but the main reason cause student to be stressful is the workload from study. Therefore, it is not a effective way to achieve the purpose.

Honestly 9 hours of skill class is bloody ridiculous and 45 hours in total is way too much.

reviews.author: HN RUBBISH
reviews.title: Rubbish courses which wastes your time
reviews.comment_content:
The Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) is a compulsory, one-year course for undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to effectively manage their life, learning and work.

In fulfillment of the course requirement, students are required to obtain a PASS in each of the 5 modules and accumulating a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year.

The 5 modules are:
Orientation
Wellness
Fitness and Training
Sports Skills Class
Activities

As all sports skills class and activities are in online mode, there are less interactions between students and tutors. We could hardly make friends in this mode. Which makes the course more boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructors are actually nice and friendly. Willing to answer questions. Is good that under the online mode the sports skills class instructors will usually remind you to listen to your body and do not overload yourselves. When you are not feeling well, the instructors will suggest you to stop immediately. Instructors will also try correct your postures and the way of doing the exercise.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail only.  So you don't need to care about good grades and competitions with other students. In the online mode, actually is relatively easy to complete that 45 hours. Just register more online talks in order to fulfill the requirement.
reviews.comment_workload: It could be large, but could be small workload. Depends on how keen you are in sports. You could simply register more talks if you hate doing exercise in order to fulfill the requirements. However, due to the COVID-19 situation, you could hardly go to the campus and do self-practices and organized activities. Which makes it less choice to fulfill the 45-hour requirements.

reviews.author: Unk
reviews.comment_content: Need 45 hours total of health class. At least attend 9 of 12 hours of sport skill class. Some of the requirements are a must, some of them need you to fill some surveys, and attend the first health class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sport skill class is very good. I went to HIIT class. The instructor Arthur LI is very kind and helpful. You can choose any sport skill class you want, but be fast.
reviews.comment_grading: No Grades are assigned. Just pass or fail.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. Only need to attend the sport skill classes. You need to check email often for additional workshops or additional sport skill class. Be fast because it will be full in hours. With workshops and sport facilities in HKUST. Very easy to complete.

reviews.author: HecoxPoon
reviews.comment_content: Need to fulfill a total of at least 45-course hours in 5 modules in one year. The 5 modules are Orientation Module(just to attend a 3-hour "Course Introduction & Getting Started@HKUST" session in late August), Wellness Module(complete 2 Surveys and 2 assessments), Fitness Training Module(2 hours Fitness Training Class), Sports Skill Class Module(like PE lessons, choose one kind of sport you want, at least 9 hours) and Activities Module (eg. go to the talk or campus sports facilities. etc, at least 23 hours)
reviews.comment_teaching: The Sports Skill Class I chose was jazz. If you are not good at dancing, it may be hard to follow the steps if you do not pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading: Just pass or fail, no letter grade. Just need to be careful not to miss anything then will get a pass.
reviews.comment_workload: Have to attend Sports Skill Class every week (PE lessons)at least 9 hours(can't skip too many lessons otherwise need pay for the extra lessons), no after class exercise for jazz so there is no much workload to say. And you have to attend some talks or campus sports facilities for at least 23 hours. Just keep in mind that don't miss anythings required(surveys and assessments) is fine.

reviews.author: Terenceng2002
reviews.comment_content: A few compulsory online seminars, online sport skills classes every week for a semester, and additional electives (voluntary work, additional sport skill classes or self training) to be completed throughout the year.
reviews.comment_teaching: For the sport skills class the instructor was patient and nice, and he tries to make the lesson more interesting by talking about how muscle groups work when we exercise. However since everything is online interactions in the lesson are limited and it's still boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Just pass/fail grading, no pressure at all.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for the course itself isn't very large as we only have to complete the required 45 hours throughout the year. However after having lectures and tutorials throughout the week no one will have mood to attend boring sports classes so the course is a kind of additional burden for students.

reviews.author: JangJackzel
reviews.title: Only Stress Free Course
reviews.comment_content:
Limited content due to online mode.

Classes include things like Yoga for Beginners, Dancing and etc.

There are only things that can be done in online mode and there aren't any ball games
reviews.comment_teaching:
All classes are taken through zoom and it can be pretty embarrassing in the beginning but you'll get used it soon quickly :)

The instructor is nice and kindly explains what to do
reviews.comment_grading:
There's no grading for this course. You just have to fulfill required hours in 2 semesters and you'll get a pass.

Fulfilling all those hours may be annoying though.
reviews.comment_workload:
There's quite a lot of hours to fulfill as a freshman.

However, there is no pressure at all as nothing is graded. You just have to show your face during the class.

Btw, if you don't turn your camera on, you'll be marked absent so do make sure that you have your cameras ready.

reviews.author: 落車請早揚聲
reviews.comment_content: It's really good excersise for us. If it wasn't for passing this class, I might not to much excersise. It also involves a lot about psychologiacal health , sense of community service, language skills and so on.( a lot of ILANG activities count as hours)
reviews.comment_teaching: Even it was online, I can see the effort instructors made to get us moving enen if we are at home.
reviews.comment_grading: just Pass or Fail. You just have to take enough attendace. (45h in a year)
reviews.comment_workload: it's a health class...how much workload could there be.

reviews.author: starbucks
reviews.comment_content: Attendance is required. The teachers are friendly.
reviews.comment_teaching: Online sem is very easy. Mostly there are only webinars or workshops that you must attend nothing else.
reviews.comment_grading: Based on attendance only XD. The surveys are time consuming. They usually take about 40 mins - 1 hour time. We are graded as pass or fail, overall the min requirement of the total hours is 42 hours. They can be easily achieved by enrolling in wellness and personal enrichment sessions.
reviews.comment_workload: Time consuming, overall, simple. No homework is given though. Timing is flexible and people usually prefer the afternoon time.

reviews.author: msi
reviews.comment_content:
content can be found on the website. some required modules/classes/surveys etc but the rest will vary from person to person.

content covers both physical and mental wellness so it's not just about fitness.
reviews.comment_teaching: will vary depending on the instructors you have, but especially the required modules can get quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading: pass/fail grading. you will pass if you fulfill all the requirements/the needed hours.
reviews.comment_workload: 45 hours in total, however things like the surveys usually don't take as long as they say. if you do sports anyway you'll probably be fine.

reviews.author: carol_
reviews.comment_content: 要做45小時既活動，同時要滿足幾個要求
reviews.comment_teaching: Sport skill class 都幾多選擇可以揀,不過報sport skill class係先排choice 再出結果,所以未必reg自己想上既course
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass同fail
滿足全部requirements 就會pass
Sport skill class 只可以走2堂，唔係會fail,要再上過
reviews.comment_workload: 要抽時間上sport skill class就有點煩，同埋要留意下email,記得reg talk同做 survey。不過talk會好快滿，所以見到有Email開新talk就要即刻reg。

reviews.author: Thomas_Ho
reviews.title: Compulsory Sports Lessons
reviews.comment_content: You can choose whatever type of sports you want but the most interesting ones will be selected by others.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor for swimming has a lot of passion and give accurate instructions and teaching.
The instructor also gives some timed exercises and record your performance then give you some feedback and suggestions.
reviews.comment_grading: Get enough hours of work and you can pass. Even if you don't have enough time in the first year, in summer sem there is a supplementary period that lets you get enough hour.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low but some classes can be early in the morning.
You only need to follow the lesson and the instructions.
But some exercises will make you very tired in the following lessons.

reviews.author: xyx
reviews.comment_content: Need minimal 45 hours of activities (workshop, sports skill classes, two surveys ( one is pre survey and another is exit survey).
reviews.comment_teaching: For sport skill class, it is good for you to learn about a new sport as I took a swimming class in the fall semester, instructor was very nice and patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail.
Need minimal 45 hours of activities. If failed, you will need to start again.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you join the sport skill class on both semester, and going to the sport hall to take records for two weeks, then the wotkload was not to much, also there is no mid-term and final exam.

For online learning, joining workshop is a good chooses as you just need to join the zoom meeting and then you can do your own stuff.

reviews.author: Hotung
reviews.comment_content:
compulsory, one-year course for all undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to effectively manage their life, learning and work.

In fulfillment of the course requirements, students are required to obtain a PASS in each of the 5 modules and accumulate a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year. Students will complete at least 45 hours of activities including talks on wellness and personal management; use of campus recreational facilities; workshops on sports, mental health and aesthetics as well as taking part in volunteer work such as organizing sports activities and participating in community service.
reviews.comment_teaching: many choices
reviews.comment_grading:
a pass
it is easy as it is online teaching this time
reviews.comment_workload:
ok
you can easily pass this if you plan your time

reviews.author: Artrix
reviews.title: Good class
reviews.comment_content: Good class with lots of practical health knowledge. Students can learn methods for making themselves healthy a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good class with lots of practical health knowledge. Teachers are making the class fun and takes it practical.
reviews.comment_grading: Good class with lots of practical health knowledge. GOOD ENOUGH grading. Just participate on schedule and you will get a great grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Good class with lots of practical health knowledge. Online class and actual practice is needed and may cost a lot time. Not EASY to handle for lazy me LOL. Adequate length!

reviews.author: Allem
reviews.comment_content: Just doing some exercise and fulfilling the minimum requirement (45hours) in first year.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Teachers will give you instructions during sports classes. Easy to follow. They are all kind and patient.
reviews.comment_grading: P/F. remember to attend the sports skill classes   there is a minimum requirement on it(at least 9 hr in the 1st sem)
reviews.comment_workload: Organizing your tine wisely. Do not leave all the hrs in the 2nd sem or you will feel stressed. There are also some courses like which will introduce the usage of facilities in gym room,  remember to register and attend those courses otherwise you may need to join the make-up lesson which is troublesome

reviews.author: Lif

Compulsory course
Required total of of 45 hours of activities (mostly relating to sport)
reviews.comment_teaching: Because of the Covid-19, this semester the sport skill class is using Zoom. Which many students actually just turn on their camera and do nothing, the teacher seems doesn't care and do nothing about it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass / Fail

Just need to do minimal 45 hours of activities and if you fail you need to do it again next year
reviews.comment_workload: Really light in this semester, since all the activities are using zoom and most of the time you do not need to do anything ( Wellness workshop)

reviews.author: Lalal
reviews.comment_content: 45 hrs，一開始盡量做得幾多係幾多，如果唔係之後唔記得，sem尾要夾時間去join其他活動，搞到自己好狼狽。

reviews.comment_grading: 只要上齊D堂，其實唔會F
reviews.comment_workload: 覺得workload還好，只要唔好柒到堂堂都唔記得，其實都冇事，印象中好似最多走2次

reviews.author: LYY

reviews.author: tterry
reviews.comment_content: 45 hours, 12 hours sports skill classes, two surveys ( one is pre survey and another is exit survey).

reviews.comment_grading: Not any grade but pass or fail. You need to pass many things in order to get a pass at the end.

reviews.author: studyhard

reviews.comment_content: Compulsory one year course, requiring students to accumulate a total of 45 hours of various activities including volunteer work, attending talks, sports skill classes etc. in order to obtain a pass.

reviews.comment_grading:
Pass/Fail

reviews.comment_workload: Attendance will be taken for the weekly sports skill classes, you will have to to be present for at least 9 hours in order to pass.

reviews.author: cyttt

reviews.author: HowardKang
reviews.title: Easy for those like doing sport
reviews.comment_content: A set of activities: self-training, PE classes, lectures, fitness class and assessment, survey, etc
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fitness class and assessment: for attendance only actually
PE class: my teacher was quite good actually, having a lot of fun
Lectures: the quality varies, but it is great to spend your time after Ocamps and before sem commencement
reviews.comment_grading: Remember to do all compulsory stuffs notified with the email, or .... congratulations on your F
reviews.comment_workload: For me, quite easy since most lectures can be taken before sem commencement and self practice is normally conducted everyday. Then I only need to follow the instructions on email and attend the PE classes.Now, I got 40 hrs in one sem (Requirement:45)

reviews.author: Aykakakakaka
reviews.comment_content: 主要都係想鼓勵你係大學入面可以搵到啲興趣/養成得閒做下運動既習慣，有五個Modules要你Fulfill到相應時數。
reviews.comment_teaching: 自己就報咗Social Dance班，個女Instructor都好Nice，雖然話係跳舞，好似好難，其實佢會Step by step同你練習，就算自認手腳唔協調最後都會叫掌握到Basic Steps。會教Cha Cha，Tango等等相對簡單既舞。

reviews.author: HinsonYip
reviews.title: Path to become more health?
reviews.comment_content: Complete 45 hours with various activities, like workshop, survey, sport skill class, etc
reviews.comment_teaching:
As the major part involved teaching in HLTH1010 is sport skill class, I
will talk something about it.

I have joined a golf sport skill class. I am satisfied with it as I can learn compulsory golf skills and enjoy the golf relaxedly. However, it is advised that you had better participate all lessons in the beginning of the semester if you don't want to be too busy at the end of the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not any grade but pass or fail.
Usually, the only thing to earn grading is to participate activities on time. Also, you have to develop a suitable activity schedule to ensure that the 45 hours requirement can be achieved.
reviews.comment_workload: This course consist of several talks, fitness assessment, surveys, skill classes. However, most of them have low workload as long as you just participate them

reviews.author: RicoMa
reviews.comment_content: There are a lot of useful information about doing exercises, and how to deal with stress. And this course gives us a good opportunity to do exercises. As academic performance is just a part of our school life.
reviews.comment_teaching: I registered the rock climbing for skill classes. Our teacher is good to encourage us to climb and make sure that we are safe when we are climbing. It is a good opportunity to play some sports that we haven't joined before.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail only
reviews.comment_workload: There are some talks, fitness assessment, surveys, skill classes. There are 45 hours in total in order to get a pass in this course.

reviews.author: Eliseeeeeeeeeee
reviews.comment_content: You must attend the lecture. There are different sport skills course you can go. I joined badminton and it is fun and relax. Also it is free to choose whether you will go any workshop or talk. I joined a lot of service and self-practice. You must have a look at the hlth 1010 website. There will be some introduction for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. Actually the tutor don’t mind what are you doing. You just need to go to the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: It is very easy to get a pass as long as you join different activities
reviews.comment_workload: Low. You only need to attend one lesson per week.

reviews.author: 404 not found
reviews.comment_content: Fulfill the minimum of 45 hours to pass the course. A friendly reminder, do not enroll swimming class in fall semester cause you need to swimming until middle November. At that time, it is in quite cold weather but you still need to swim in the outdoor swimming pool.
reviews.comment_teaching: I took a swimming class in the fall semester and a badminton class in the spring semester, both instructors are very nice and patient.
reviews.comment_grading: No grading, just pass or fail. If you fail the course, you need to take on the following academic year.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload.

reviews.author: Jinu
reviews.title: untitled
reviews.comment_content: You can check the content at myportal healthy lifestyle section.
reviews.comment_teaching: I'm playing soccer for skilled classes. Good teaching
reviews.comment_grading: There's not much to say about grading since it is a health program. Try to finish the program during the first year so that you won't have to take the course next year with harder subjects to study for
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is actually quite heavy considering that you have to register for the programs and participate in the required sections. I can't believe this is a requirement for a University student.

reviews.author: Max Tam
reviews.title: One semester finish strategy
reviews.comment_content:
A great variety of sports that you can join: like lectures, talks, activities and of course sports. Join all compulsory talks and focus on these three aspects:
Self practice, sports skills class and organised sports.

10 + 14 + 12 + 14 = is more than enough hours to complete in semester
reviews.comment_teaching: Valley good
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail. I guess good grading.
reviews.comment_workload: If you want to finish it as quick as possible, you will got to use all your free time to take attendance. OR you can just tap the card at the take attendance system then leave then come back one hours later to get the hour (especially in self practice)

reviews.author: Jamesccc
reviews.comment_content:
learn how to exercise
45 hours, 6/8 sports skill classes, a few surveys
reviews.comment_teaching:
depends on different sports
Before taking this class, I knew nothing.

What were these "muscles"? What was a "gym"? Fear not, this class will teach you everything you want to know on how to have a healthy lifestyle.

The seminar on how to enjoy a healthy lifestyle was very intriguing and informative. I learned many things. After the seminar, I have made drastic changes to my lifestyle.

I am now gluten free.
I am also a vegan.

There was also a seminar on why exercise is important, which came with a few demonstrations of how to perform various exercises. This was the moment that changed my life.

The feeling of exercise is better than life itself.

The pain.

Oh, the pain, from working muscles you've never discovered. It was like sex. But much, much better.

We were practicing stretches when the instructor told me to get on my hands and knees. I was excited for my very first time. I was going to receive. Receive, that is, knowledge of how to exercise.

"Today," he said. "I will be teaching you how to do push-ups." He continued to demonstrate the "push-up" a couple times.

Eventually, it came our turn to try out these "push-ups." I lowered my body slowly down onto the ground. I was tense and trying to keep my balance. My palms were sweaty. Knees weak, arms were heavy. There was vomit on my sweater already, mom's spaghetti.

I couldn't hold it any longer. I pushed myself up, and then I felt it. It was like my whole body had an orgasm, an orgasm I couldn't contain. It was pure ecstasy. It's the same confused, yet satisfying feeling when a little boy gets his first erection. It was love. It was life. It was Shrek.

Needless to say, I had to change my undies before moving onto the next exercise.
reviews.comment_grading:
once finished the requirement, you will pass the course
Very intense. High failure rate. Sometimes, the instructors can be heartless and lock you outside the room when you're late.
reviews.comment_workload: easy

reviews.author: tingcymimi
reviews.comment_content: Easy to follow if you have got into a beginner's class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Depends on which class have you got in. The beginners of badminton class is also very easy. Just some basic techniques. Some teachers will give more free time for us to practise. It also depends.
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to pass unless you didnt show up for more than 2 times.
Just attend all the lessons then you will get a pass.
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload cuz there are no final exam and mid term exam in my class. Just show up and finish all the lessons.

reviews.author: unknown10
reviews.title: Compulsory Course for Year 1
reviews.comment_content: Not much content, just remember to be on time for the classes and workshops.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is very helpful but then depends on the coach you have.
reviews.comment_grading: You can either pass or fail depending on what you do in this course. It is quite easy so most people pass. However, if you fail, you have to retake it next year and plus pay a fee for it I think.
reviews.comment_workload: It can be hectic sometimes to plan out your timetable according to the workshops. Therefore, it is advisable to plan out these workshops before hand. Sometimes, its easier to go join these workshops in summer or first few weeks of uni as there is less workload.

reviews.author: KIKC
reviews.comment_content: There are 5 module of this course. You should finish 45 hours in one year include sport skill class, fitness class, survey, voluntary work, lots of talks etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Depends on which sport skill class  you choose. Different sport skill class may have different workload.
reviews.comment_grading: This course only has pass or fail grade. It is easy to pass.
reviews.comment_workload: It is not very heavy. Apart from attending sport skill class, self practice is a good and easy way to gain 12 hours of the 45 hours. Also, remember to attend the talks to gain hours too.

reviews.author: Ysh
reviews.comment_content:
It is a compulsory course. Student required to obtain a pass in each of the 5 modules and accumulating a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year.
Orientation Module, Wellness Module, Fitness Training Module, Sports Skill Class Module, Activities Module
reviews.comment_teaching: Depends on which sport activity you choose. You can choose different activities. Instructors will be different for each course.
reviews.comment_grading: Only have pass and fail. Attend the lesson that you reg-ed will be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable workload. Attend the sport skill classes and workshops, do surveys go to gym is ok.

reviews.author: Kacy Man
reviews.comment_content: Obtain at least 45 hours in 5 modules
reviews.comment_teaching: Only the sport skill class involved some teaching. I joined squash class in the fall semester which was comparatively a small class and easy to meet some new friends. The instructor taught new squash techniques every lesson which would be a bit difficult for beginners to catch up. In the spring semester, I joined badminton class. It was really relaxing and generally no teaching. You simply played badminton with your friends or you could even chat for the whole lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: Just pass or fail. It is super easy to get a pass if you attend all the compulsory sessions and obtain 45 hours in total.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. You just need to manage your time and better to complete it as earlier as you can.

reviews.author: LSF
reviews.comment_content: It is just doing something other than studying for 45 hours within a year, such as attending sports skill class, voluntary work, talks, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: There is nearly no teaching other than sports skill classes.  I chose basketball and I think the class mainly focuses on students who knew how to play.  The coach was teaching something more advanced for students to improve their skills.
reviews.comment_grading: There is only pass and fail in the course, so attendance is quite important for passing the sports skill class.  Just simply fulfill the requirements and attend the compulsory talks, mainly in the beginning and the end of the year.
reviews.comment_workload: For sports lovers, it should not be hard for them to fulfill the requirements.  For others, try your best to attend different talks and voluntary works with health 1010 hours counted.  Do check for the maximum hours for each category so that you are not wasting your time.

reviews.author: happy321
reviews.comment_content: Doing sports, joining activities, and attending sports courses

reviews.author: Chrisheihei
reviews.comment_content: Do sports and have fun. There are different kinds of activities that are counted in this court.

reviews.author: ust123
reviews.comment_content: Choosing a sport (eg swimming, badminton, golf, yoga, dance, tennis), listening to health talks and doing some surveys about your health.

reviews.author: LYK

reviews.comment_workload: In fact, it is light. Relax. Just attend the sport skill classes, do surveys, also join some talks & workshops and go to gym.

reviews.author: stevensin

睇人，我自己sport skill class(rugby)就教得幾好
啲talk都係睇人，有個餐桌禮儀嘅insturctor幾搞笑
reviews.comment_grading:
輕輕鬆鬆pass
都唔洗特登好辛苦去meet requirement
reviews.comment_workload:
輕輕鬆鬆
如果唔洗聽talk就會比較好

reviews.author: Tsz Mei
reviews.title: hlth1010
reviews.comment_content:
1 compulsory sports skill class
and some required talk and activities.
Accumulate 45 hours of recognized activities, like self-practices sports, organized sports, talks, workshop, voluntary works.
Usually, people will join 2 sports skill class, one in fall semester and one in spring semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: the tutor of sports skill class is quite nice, I have attended Yuga, quite relaxing, but it is very popular, not easy to get in to the Yuga class.

reviews.comment_workload: appropriate, usually people will only go and swap their ID card for the hour of self-practices.

reviews.author: natkung
reviews.comment_content:
45 hours
- 3 hours for orientation
- 5 hours for wellness
- 2 hours for fitness training
- 9-12 hours for sports skill class
- 23-26 hours for other activities
  --> 12 hours for additional sports skill class
  --> 14 hours for organized sports
  --> 14 hours for self practie
  --> 14 hours for wellness and personal enrichment
  --> 14 hours for community or voluntary work
(choose from the above to fulfill 23-26 hours)

reviews.author: UEL K.
reviews.title: Complicated yet easy to finish
reviews.comment_content:
Year 1 must-take course, otherwise fail and retake.
A total of 45 hours is required to finish.
Can be divided into 5 parts :
- Orientation
- Wellness
- Fitness training
- Sports Skill Class(at least 9hrs; at most 12hrs)
- Activities(at least 23hrs; at most 26hrs)

1. Orientation consists mainly of 2 talks,
both on the same day of late August, you must register in advance and go, otherwise fail.
2. Wellness contains 4 surveys and 1 fitness assessment,
just regularly check email for the surveys, register the assessment in advance and go, otherwise fail.
3. Fitness training comprises of a mini-lecture and workshop to teach you how to use the gym equipment.
Just register in advance and go, otherwise fail.
4. You can join at most 2 different sport skill classes in fall and spring separately, the class format is similar to other normal classes. You can prioritize up to 10 courses you like.
5. In "Activities", just join Athletics Meet, some of HKUST's volunteer events and stay tuned for any "HLTH1010 hrs"-marked email is okay.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This Fall I joined Social Dance class. I would say if you really want to learn something unfamiliar, the course is far enough for you to take. Of course, you can skip classes when busy, yet make sure you should attend the first few class so that you can follow the teaching pace (also at least you have to attend for 9hrs!!!).

The teacher is quite nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail

Useful link :
https://hlth1010.ust.hk/modules/orientation.html
reviews.comment_workload:
Actually just keep checking email and register in advance when you are free.

For those who want to speed up their progress, a trick is to take your card record at the LG4 Fitness Center regularly, say between 1-hr interval. But I think you should do this at the very last time since I always forgot to record my card for the second time, which became useless.

reviews.author: pinkckwc
reviews.title: table tennis
reviews.comment_content:
The Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) is a compulsory, one-year course for all undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to effectively manage their life, learning and work.

In fulfillment of the course requirements, students are required to obtain a PASS in each of the 5 modules and accumulate a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year. Students will complete at least 45 hours of activities including talks on wellness and personal management; use of campus recreational facilities; workshops on sports, mental health and aesthetics as well as taking part in volunteer work such as organizing sports activities and participating in community service.
reviews.comment_teaching: I attended a table- tennis course and it is so easy. there is  air conditioner. This is the most important!!! The teacher is good. She demonstrates first and then you practice with others. there is warm up before the start of playing table tennis. It is easy even you are a beginner like me.
reviews.comment_grading: you just need to finish 45 hours and you will easily get a pass
reviews.comment_workload: There are five mintes break for twice each lesson. You have to make sure that no balls are on the floor at the end of the lesson. Unluckily, you need to attend at least six lessons.

reviews.author: Keju
reviews.comment_content:
Spend 45 hours of your semester to engage in their activities.

Mandatory ones:
3 hours - 2 orientation lectures (1 and 2 hours each)
2 hours - health and fitness assessment
1 hour - wellness survey (mental health)
2 hours - intake&exit survey
2 hours - fitness lecture (how to use gym equipments)
9 hours - sports skill class (up to 12 hours per semester)
--total: 19 hours.

Remaining 26 hours can be achieved through:
Max. 14 hours: self-practice in gym (max 1 hr/day)
Max. 12 hours: additional sports skill class
Max. 14 hours: Organized sports
Max. 14 hours: Wellness&Personal enrichment (lectures)
Max. 14 hours: Community&Voluntary work

(If you're in school of engineering, the orientation day itself gives you 4 hours)

There are lots of ways to get hours - certain events also offer HLTH1010 hours.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The sports skill class is good for learning new Sports - I hope they let us review each individual sport skill class!

Other than that, the lectures are boring as they teach you things you should already know. If you didn't know those things, you must've lived under a rock. Stop studying for academics too much bro.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass/Fail.

As long as you fulfill the 45 hours and attend all the mandatory lectures and assessment, finish the compulsory surveys and participate in the sports skill class at least 9 hours out of 12, you pass.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's really easy to get all the 45 hours, especially since they gave you one whole year.

Going to the gym a total of 14 times on 14 different days for at least 40 minutes each time gives you 14 hours.

That leaves you 12 more hours.

Participate in another sports skill class the other semester and get the remaining 12 hours, or participate in other HLTH1010-endorsed lectures, workshops, camps, event etc. There's plenty. Don't worry too much about it. 45 hours may seem like a lot, but it's really not.

reviews.author: Betty
reviews.title: accumulate minimum of 45 hrs of activities which are regarded as healthy
reviews.comment_content:
There are some compulsory tasks and elective tasks.
For the compulsory section, you are required to attend some compulsory talks, like the "getting start@HKUST", and some surveys. Most importantly, you have to attend at least 1 sports skill class with a minimum of 9 hrs, that's is you can only skill TWO times only.
For the elective section, you can choose to do volunteer work, join A meet, gym, or additional sports skills
reviews.comment_teaching:
I have attended yoga as my sports skill class, it helped me relax, but it also caused me sleepy.
The tutor is quite nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is quite easy to pass as long as you have accumulated at least 45 hrs. Some societies also count hlth1010 hrs.
But for the same section or subsection, there is a maximum, so be aware of it.
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, it depends on whether your will. If you love sports, it is easy to get a pass. But if you hate sports or attending talks, then it is quite painful to fulfil this 45 hrs.
45 hrs for a year is still quite ok and reasonable.

reviews.comment_teaching:
For me, I took Softball for beginners on Friday mornings.
The coach has poor English that you can hardly understand, protection is not enough and students always get injured -- BLEEDING LEVEL OF INJURIES.
So, it really depends on the class you chose
reviews.comment_grading:
Only pass or fail.
If you are aware of the deadlines, finish the survey and the health assessment. It is nearly impossible to fail.

Please be reminded that you must choose a sports skills class that you are able to attend. It counts 9 hours of compulsory part, which means if you didnt take enough classes, you will fail. And the first lesson of sports skills class is compulsory.
reviews.comment_workload:
The survey just takes you minutes to complete and you can do your own stuff or sleep during the talks.
These do not requires any effort.
Thus, hitting the gym (actually just swipe your card) is also super easy.
The sad thing is, if you choose a bad sports skills class, you will suffer.
Mine is at the court near seafront, which is SUPER HOT and softball itself is hard. Especially when you cannot understand your coach's instruction.
Moreover, the class I chose is at 9am. Although being a little bit late is okay, you still need to get up early and travel if you are not living in halls.
Most likely, the sports skills class lasts for 8 lessons, 1.5hours per 1. You can skip 2 lessons and still get a pass.

reviews.comment_content:
- Orientation before the start of school
- Health and fitness assessment at the beginning of school
- Some surveys to fill in
- Sports skill class
- 45 mandatory hours (the above mandatory activities are included)

To complete your mandatory hours, you can sign up for talks (make sure to bring your student ID card to sign in and sometimes sign out), go to the gym or play table tennis with friends (again, sign in and out), sign up for an extra Sports Skill Class in the second semester, volunteer, etc - many of which are activities that I would have engaged in anyways.
Some people didn't get into a sports skill class in the first semester
Some of the sports skill classes are really interesting and I would not have had the opportunity to try out these activities otherwise. However, don't expect to be able to be working out for the entire duration of the class if you are in a class like sport climbing.
