reviews.author: gearlessjoe
reviews.title: Mostly a waste of time but mandatory for Year 1
reviews.comment_content:
45 hours total, 5 modules to complete
1. Orientation — 3 hour talk with nothing important
2. Wellness — do the surveys the HLTH office sends you
3. Fitness training — 2 hour class on staying healthy and using gym equipment — really just a brief overview, if you're really interested in gymming you have to learn yourself
4. Sports skill classes — at least 9 hours in one sport, good opportunity to try new sports without committing to sports clubs yet
5. Activities (electives) — other activities with approved HLTH1010 hours, organized sports in school (e.g. in school swim gala), wellness and personal enrichment (swipe card at gym/sports ground/pool and practice yourself), volunteering (if you aren't keen on doing sports) — you can't just volunteer/practice yourself for the entire activities module so make sure you join other activities to fulfill this module
reviews.comment_teaching:
As mentioned in content, the orientation was pretty much a waste of time.
The fitness training was a waste of time for me because I already knew all the key concepts but for a complete beginner to fitness it would be useful I guess. The equipment training part is kind of common sense — follow the instructions on the machine and make sure the pin/selector is fully inserted into the weight before using the machine so you don't injure yourself.
The sports skill class I can't really say, it depends on what sports you signed up for.
reviews.comment_grading:
Graded pass or fail.
You can check how many hours you've logged at the student portal (might take a few days to update).
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload for me, I regularly exercise so I didn't need as many hours to full the rest of the activities module requirement.
For those that don't like sports just pay attention to your email for easy activities that have HLTH1010 hours like the handprint world record thing, or maybe try regularly exercising for a while and see if you like it or not.

reviews.author: SQ Flyer
reviews.title: Gaining 45hrs is not a problem if you manage your time well
reviews.comment_content:
HLTH1010 is a compulsory course for all Year 1 who are new to UST. The 45hrs non-credit bearing course consists of different components, to complete the course requirement, it is suggested that students should manage their time well and attend all the required seminars and activities punctually. Registration of different activities and classes should be taken after the opening of the system.

Complete the surveys punctually should guarantee you to get at least 4 hrs, so check email regularly and complete the link given.

Fitness training class and the fitness assessment are not that demanding, providing opportunities to assess you ability and physical fitness.

Sports skill class should be a difficult part since you have to grab a good time slot and less demanding sport activity which helps you release stress and tension.

Going to gym regularly and join some activities organised by the university and the schools actually help you to gain at least 23hrs, better get used to it.
reviews.comment_teaching: tutors are still fine but some classes are actually boring, especially when you have to tackle with your study.

1. do take note on the enrollment day cuz usually the activity enrollment is under the first-come-first-serve basis

No grade, just pass or fail.

reviews.comment_workload: 45 hours in a whole semester isn't hard to achieve right?

Pass if you fulfill the compulsory activity requirement and 45 hours requirement.

reviews.comment_teaching: Somehow boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. To get a PASS in the course, students must obtain a PASS in each of the 5 modules and accumulate a total of at least 45 course hours by 3 May 2018.

2. In addition to meet the minimum requirement of the individual modules, students must attain a minimum combined total of 35 hours from the "Sports Skill Class" and the "Activities" modules.

3. Self sports practice must be carried out at on-campus sports facilities during the normal opening hours of these facilities. Self sports practice for less than 40 minutes will NOT be recorded.

4. Students MUST dressed in appropriate sports wear when attending the self sports practices. Students who are found not present at the sports facilities and/or not dressed in appropriate sports attire during the
log-in hours will be penalized.

5. The event instructor/ presenter may exclude the course event participants who are not participating or uncooperative to attain the event course hours.
reviews.comment_workload: at least 45 course hours

reviews.author: Laura Chan
reviews.comment_content:
The Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) is a compulsory, one-year course for all undergraduates to learn how to maintain a well-balanced and healthy lifestyle that will help them to effectively manage their life, learning and work.

In fulfillment of the course requirements, students are required to obtain a PASS in each of the 5 modules and accumulate a total of at least 45 course hours in the academic year. Students will complete at least 45 hours of activities including talks on wellness and personal management; use of campus recreational facilities; workshops on sports, mental health and aesthetics as well as taking part in volunteer work such as organizing sports activities and participating in community service.
reviews.comment_grading: pass/fail

reviews.author: Ronald Ng
reviews.title: Mandatory
reviews.comment_content:
Accumulate a total of 45 course hours in 1st year, which include a series of lectures , fitness training,  skill classes, self-practice and surveys..


24 Aug - 25 Aug : Orientation --- getting started@HKUST (3-hour lecture, 3 hours of HLTH course hours)
28 Aug - 29 Aug ; 1 Sep - Mid Sep : Fitness training class (Learning to use certain equipments at the gym, 2 hours of HLTH course hours)
Mid September: Survey
Registration starts early-September: Sports skill classes (eg. badminton, basketball, swimming, tennis, table tennis)

Workshops, participation in selected interest clubs / societies, community services, self practice are counted towards HLTH  course hours.

Every freshmen must obtain 45 course hours in order to Pass. Failing to do so may lead to retake of HLTH1010 in the next year.

reviews.comment_content:
Gain 45 course hours for the whole year(until May). (At least 19 from compulsory events and 26 hours from 'Activities Module' (electives)
Check out here for what to do. https://sao.ust.hk/HLTH1010/events/index.html
Make sure to check your ust email frequently so that you won't miss any compulsory surveys. (Missing the deadlines will lead to a fail)
Also frequently check your course hours record in myPortal .(Home>Healthy Lifestyle Course)
reviews.comment_teaching:
'Getting Started@HKUST & Course Introduction Session': Introduction to ust, the course, and some official programs that the school thinks you shouldn't miss.

'Fitness Lecture & Practicum'
Introduction to 'fitness', how to set up a fitness plan, and how to use gym equipments. Remember to wear appropriate sports wear, as some instructors may deny you from participating if you don't do so.

'Sport Skill Class'
You must complete at least 9 hours(1.5 hours each lesson, total 8/9 lessons, so you can skip some) of such classes. Content and quality depends on which sport you choose. If you are unlucky enough like me, you will receive no offer after you make the enrollment, and then you need to pick up vacant quotas in 'leftover' classes, usually dancing and football. I chose football(‘for begineers’), and it can be a little physically demanding if the instructor decides to let you play in the whole pitch on a hot, sunny day(but if not enough students show up he may ask us to play half the football pitch).
reviews.comment_grading: Just graded 'pass' or 'fail'. As long as you keep track of the course hours gained and the completion of compulsory parts on time, you won't fail.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends. There are numerous paths to fulfill all the requirements, for example you can register an additional sport skill classes and also use the gym/sports hall to gain 14 hours of 'Self practise'. You can also enroll in HLTH1010 endorsed workshops/talks frequently(but don't wait till Spring term to do that). For me, I joined some school year-long personal developments programs and participated in some volunteer activities(especially the Athletic Meet helper - 8 hours), and already gained 39.5 hours (including compulsory sessions) the end of fall term. So plan your schedule early and it's not hard.

reviews.comment_content:
45 hours
5 Module

Orientation
    - Course Introduction Session 1 hour
    - Getting Started@HKUST
Wellness
    - Intake Survey
    - Health & Fitness Assessments
    - Wellness Assessment
    - Exit Survey
Fitness Training
Fitness Lecture & Practicum
Sports Skill Class
Activities
    - Additional Sports Skill Class
    - Organized Sports
    - Self Practice
    - Wellness & Personal Enrichment
    - Community or Voluntary Work
reviews.comment_teaching: Nil
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to achieve, but very boring.

For the first three module: 10 hours
For the fourth module: 12 hours
For the fifth module: 11 hours of self practice and 12 hours of wellness
Total: 45 hours
reviews.comment_workload:
You can finish most of it within 1 semester(except the exit survey).

For first module, it is very easy to achieve as it is only zoom meeting.
For the second module, you can finish the survey very quickly. It won't waste a lot of time.
For the third module, it is F2F and you need to listen for  1 hour and for the another hour, you will have the chance to try the equipment.
For the fourth module, I enrolled the Learn to Swim (but I know how to swim, so not a big deal)
For the fifth module, I go to self practice and enroll Wellness & Personal Enrichment talk. All zoom and some of them requires you to open your camera and some do not. It really depends on the speaker. Sometimes you are also required to do survey.

Yoga for Beginners

Yoga is a science and an art of healthy living. It has much to offer for the mind, spirit and body which further enhance the efficiency and total health. The whole Yoga system is built on three main structures: exercise, breathing and meditation.

Class activities include breathing techniques which enable participants to raise their breath control gently in order to improve health and function of body and mind. This process of breath control can further integrate stretching exercise to prepare body and mind for meditation.

reviews.author: NCH
reviews.comment_content: I am sorry. This isn't a valid review. Required 4 modules.Students are required to attend a 3-hour "Getting Started@HKUST & Course Introduction" session in late August. In the session, students will learn about the Healthy Lifestyle Course (HLTH1010) requirements and the wide range of resources to support students in leading a healthy and happy life on campus. They will also learn about the part they can play so that all of us will live and learn harmoniously in a diverse and dynamic environment. In addition, they will find out what they need to know to tailor a path for their first year success through hearing stories from senior students about how they made the most of their university experience.
reviews.comment_teaching: Healthy lifestyle is closely related to wellness. Wellness refers to a fine balance of the mind-body and spirit that would result in a person’s overall feeling of well being. It is an integration of physical, intellectual, emotional, spiritual, social, environmental and occupational aspects of life. It is commonly conceptualized in the following 7 dimensions:
reviews.comment_grading: 2-hour Fitness Training Class comprising lecture on fitness concepts and planning exercise workouts as well as practicum on using the fitness equipment at the campus Fitness Center. The class aims at helping students to learn the proper use of the equipment inside the Fitness Center as a way in maintaining regular exercise during their studies in the university. Students will obtain 2 course hours attendance after completing this required component.
reviews.comment_workload:
The Sports Skill Class module is one of the core requirements of the HLTH1010 course. Students are expected to attend ALL sessions in a class and to complete at least 9 hours in a sports skill class to fulfill the "Sports Skill Class" module requirement. Students are encouraged to do so in the Fall Term. Attendance in additional sports skill classes will be counted towards the attendance in the "Activities" module.

The Sports Skill Classes are designed to suit the needs of participants who may have no prior knowledge or experience in the selected sports activities. The classes will cover a wide range of sports activities including aquatic activities, rhythmic activities, combat activities, fitness and wellness activities as well as individual and team sports. Each class has 12 contact hours comprising sessions of 1.5 to 2 hours each. The class schedules and registration details will be announced at the beginning of each Term.

The physical education professional staff is responsible for class design and planning while qualified instructors (full-time and part-time) will conduct the classes. Participants will get feedback on their progress and development during the class sessions.
